explanation: Nisab is the minimum amount that a muslim must have before being obliged to give zakat. Zakat i determined based on the amount of wealth acquired; the greater one's assets, the greater the zakat value.

text: The Miraj is associated with Prophet
explanation: Miraj is an Arabic word meaning "ladder, to elevate, or to ascend". In Islamic literature it is used for the night journey of Prophet Muhammad when he was miraculously taken to the presence of Allah (God) in Heaven. According to the Islamic faith it is one of the major miracles of the Prophet.

explanation: Quran 24 vs 31And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. text:
"By Him who dominates my soul, I swear that you're the Prophet of this nation... you will be abused and you will be persecuted. If I should ever live to see that day, I shall surely help the cause of Allah"

text: Reference to a special night is made in Surat
explanation: Al-Qadr is the 97th chapter of the Qur'an with 5 ayat and verses. It is a Meccan surah which celebrates the special night when the first revelation of what would become the Qur'an was sent down.

text: Makkan Surah with the main objective of reassuring the Prophet(SAW) at a time of distress is
explanation: The 93rd chapter of the Quran, Surah Duha focuses mainly on the Prophet. This surah was revealed to Prophet Muhammad (saw) at a time when he had not received any revelation for six months, not even in the form of a dream! The Prophet (saw) was in a very disturbed state of mind, feeling negative and depressed and believing that Allah was displeased with him, had forgotten him, and did not want him as a Nabi anymore.

text: The waiting period of a divorced woman is termed
explanation: In Islam, iddah or iddat is the period a woman must observe after the death of her husband or after a divorce, during which she may not marry another man. One of its main purposes is to remove any doubt as to the paternity of a child born after the divorce or death of the prior husband.

text: The Truce of al-Hudaybiyyah included terms such as

options.A: payment of reparations to the Makkans by the Ummah
options.B: the observance by both parties of a ten year period of peace
options.C: prevention of Muslims from entering Makkah until ten years later
options.D: the encouragement of the Makkans to join the Muslims in al-Madanah

explanation: In 628 CE, 1,394 years ago, the treaty of Hudaybiyyah was signed; it is considered a landmark in Islam's history. What happened in Hudaybiyyah was a kind of peace treaty signed by the idolaters of Mecca and the Muslims. It was signed in the village of Hudaybiyyah, located about nine miles (14.5 km) outside Mecca, thereby acknowledging the equality of Muslims as bargaining partners.It included terms such as the observance by both parties of a ten year period of peace.

text: The expressions Iqra, allama and al-qalam in Surat al-Alaq emphasize the importance of
explanation: They all emphasize the importance of Knowledge.

text: The authenticity of a hadith may be faulted if

options.A: its wording is too close to the text of the Qur'an
options.B: it is no longer than a verse of the Qur'an
options.C: its narrator was not from Makkah

explanation: The authenticity of a hadith may be faulted if it contradicts a Quranic injunction

text: The divine attribute of omnipotence is implied in
explanation: Suratul al-Qadir is also known as Surah of the Omnipotent.

text: Fortune telling is un-islamic

options.A: only when it is done by non-Muslims
options.B: when Islamic scriptures are not used for it
options.C: only in matters relating to religious practices
options.D: at all times and in all matters

explanation: Islam has taken a strong position against visitation of fortune tellers and the art of fortunetelling. The Islamic ruling with regard to a Muslim who visits a fortuneteller and believes what he (the fortuneteller) tells him or believes that the fortuneteller knows the unseen and the future, is that it is kufr (disbelief), according to the scholars. They based their evidence on the saying of Allah: "With Him are the Keys of the Ghayb (unseen); none knows them but He."(Qur'an 6:59).

text: Accountability is an act of worship

options.A: though it is not mentioned in the Qur'an
options.B: because it is specifically mentioned in the Qur'an
options.C: being one of the fundamental principles of Islam
options.D: in matters relating to religious rites

explanation: The concept of accountability is specifically mentioned in the Quran and hence, an act of worship.

text: The second hadith in an-Nawawi's collection teaches that it is righteousness to worship Allah as if

options.A: one would die the following day
options.B: He would punish one on the spot

explanation: Hadith 2 of an-Nawawi collection teaches righteousness to worship Allah as if one is seeing Him. "It is that you should serve Allah as though you could see Him, for though you cannot see Him yet (know that) He sees you."

text: The pre-Islamic practice of shigar which was abolished by Islam meant
explanation: In Islam. Shighar is the practice of exchanging brides between two families, where the girl and dowry of one family is exchanged for a girl and dowry from another family.

explanation: The employment of scholars of Arabic as envoys by kings and emperors was one of the ways by which Islamic civilization was manifested in West Africa

explanation: It is obligatory on all Muslims to seek knowledge hence ignorance of religious rites and duties is not excusable in Islam.

text: Which of the following actions may be regarded as Mubah?
explanation: Mubah is something that there is no objection to doing it in terms of religion; that is, a person is free to do it or not to do it. Shaking hands is an example of such.

text: The most important use of Tafsir of the Glorious Qur'an is in the
explanation: Tafsir is the science of explanation of the Qurʾān, the sacred scripture of Islam, or of Qurʾānic commentary.

text: The initial idea to preserve the Glorious Qur'an was mooted by
explanation: After the demise of the Prophet(p), the first Caliph Abu Bakr, assembled all the Huffaz (those who have committed the Quran to memory), and the written records of the Glorious Quran and with their help had the whole text written in Book form.

text: Q. 4:34 enjoins the wife not only to be obedient but also to
explanation: Q. 4:34 enjoins the wife not only to be obedient but also to maintain her chastity.

text: Talaq al ba in means divorce that is
explanation: This type of talaq occurs when nikah is completely annulled and the couple cannot live together anymore. If husband and wife both agree to get back together, they must renew their nikah which means they have to performed their nikah again. This type of divorce is known as talaqul ba'in.

text: By the year 1110 C.E., Andalusia had fallen under the control of

explanation: Ribat was originally used as a term to describe a frontier post where travelers (particularly soldiers) could stay to promote Islam.

explanation: Munkar is one name that covers everything banned by Allah.

text: One of the contribution of Islam to women welfare is the introduction of
explanation: One of the contribution of Islam to women welfare is the introduction of inheritance. In Islam, women are entitled the right of inheritance, though generally, Islam allots women half the share of inheritance available to men if they inherit from the same father. For example, where the decedent has both male and female children, a son's share is double that of a daughter's.

explanation: Most Makkan Suwar are short and poetic.

text: A father or guardian can give out his daughter or ward in marriage under the principle of Ijbar provided that the

options.A: girl has attained the age of maturity
options.D: groom does not have any physical disability

explanation: A father or guardian can give out his daughter or ward in marriage under the principle of Ijbar provided that the girl is a minor. Under Islamic law, a wali mujbir has an authority to contract the marriage of his virgin daughter even though she does not agree with the marriage. The authority is known as wilayat al-ijbar and quite often described as marriage by compulsion.

text: Sadaq is the exclusive property of the
explanation: The Dower (Sadaq) is a sum of money or other property which becomes. payable by the husband to the wife as an effect of marriage. The Quran ordains: "And give the women ( on marriage) their dower as a free gift." ( 4:4) In another. Hence it is the property of the wife.
